content.description:
Climb past 4 bolts protecting a crescent-shaped flake, then continue up (the rest is gear protected) past angling cracks to a crux move to gain a vertical crack.

Continue up the corner/crack to the anchors.
content.protection: 4 bolts, single rack #00-.4", doubles in the blue TCU/black Totem size. Steel carabiner anchors.
content.location: The first route right of the old top-rope cracks. From the large ledge that is the start for "Kick Aspen", scramble left and down to a small ledge to start.

content.description: Face climb past bolts to a steepening traverse. Continue left at a bulge to a unique hold and a mantle. Continue up and left to anchors.
content.protection:
7 bolts, one optional .3" piece above bulge.

Mussy Hook anchors.

content.description: Start with a move left through an overhang, then climb a face to a left-angling flake/crack. Work left to jugs above the corner, make a move right over the roof and continue to anchors . Mussy Hooks, lower off.
content.location: Scramble to the next ledge above RFWH

content.description:
Climb the right side of a pillar to a hanging flake, clip a bolt, then step right onto the face. Continue past another bolt to an left-angling crack to a stance with another bolt. Easier but still challenging climbing leads to an exit right at a horizontal hand crack. Scramble to the anchors.

Mussy Hook anchors, lower off.

~~~~

In memory of a good friend.
content.protection: 3 bolts, gear to .75” The crux is gear-protected.
content.location: The next climb right of "Horatio Hornslinger"

content.description: Dihedral to arete just left of an obvious gully
content.location: Scramble up the slope past the hard-man routes above the old road, this is the most down-hill & first route one encounters.

content.description: Shares start & anchor with Thirstin' Howl. Face to overlaps, finishes with tricky roof moves to an easy exit.
content.protection: Top-rope with a direction piece at the roof.
content.location: Same start as Thirstin' Howl. Cut left at second bolt.

content.description:
The next route to the right of Parcher's Prow. Scramble up an easy left-facing flake feature to gain a secondary ledge. Belay from here.

Climb face and cracks, traversing left to a vertical crack. Mussy hooks, lower off
content.protection: Gear to .75" Bring long runners for slinging features & off-set gear.

content.description: Fun, easy xenolith climbing leads to a series of thin, techy moves past 3 closely-spaced bolts with high clips & decent rests. The route finishes on some more, harder moves between knobs. A tricky mantle devoid of grips guards the anchors.
content.protection:
7 bolts, optional .3-.5" to protect the starting moves.

Steel 'biner anchors.
content.location:
Start on the same ledge as "Horatio Hornslinger", but climb straight up to the first bolt.

Alternately, one can scramble up onto the ledge that shares a start with "RFMR", and make an easy move left to gain the clip stance.

content.description: Delicate and fun flake and seam climbing to an unfortunate ramp in the middle of the climb. An airy traverse left leads to a mantle, then more face and flakes to the anchors. Clip directionals for top-roping.
content.location: Just left of "Parcher's Prow". On the approach to the Prow & Horatio, look for a short trail to a spacious ledge on the left. Start at the double cracks right of a dirt ramp.
